In addition, the Israeli military fired artillery and white phosphorus shells and conducted raids to aid in the infiltration. The Israeli military also booby trapped several buildings with explosives and detonated them in Wadi Al Assafir area of the town. This event is part of what the Israeli army called its 'new phase' of its war on Gaza, amid hostilities against Hezbollah. Casualties unknown. notes: On 29 October 2024, at around 10 am, Hezbollah fighters and Israeli soldiers clashed in Khiyam (Marjayoun, Al Nabatieh). assoc_actor_2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
source: Deutsche Welle; L'Orient Le Jour; National News Agency Lebanon
notes: On 11 October 2024, at around 3 pm, Hezbollah fighters attacked Israeli soldiers in Ras al Naqoura (Tyr, South). Israeli soldiers fired 120 mm shells. Casualties unknown. Hezbollah claimed the attack in support of Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip, as well as their resistance, and in defense of Lebanon and its people. The Israeli military fired artillery shells at the entrance of the UNIFIL headquarters, near an observation tower. Two explosions injured two peacekeepers from the Sri Lankan battalion. One had to be taken to a hospital in Tyr, another has been treated in Naqoura. The UNIFIL headquarters have been targeted for the 2nd time in 48 hours (coded separately) by the Israeli army, who claimed it was an accident. On 13 October 2024, Netanyahu called on UNIFIL to immediately move from their positions.

source: L'Orient Le Jour; National News Agency Lebanon
notes: On 11 October 2024, at 4:40 pm, Hezbollah fighters launched missiles at a gathering of Israeli soldiers near Blida (Marjayoun, Al Nabatieh). Later at 9:20 pm, Hezbollah affiliates fired artillery shells. Casualties unknown. Hezbollah claimed the attack in support of Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip, as well as their resistance, and in defense of Lebanon and its people.

source: L'Orient Le Jour; National News Agency Lebanon; Telegram
notes: On 11 October 2024, twice, Hezbollah fighters fired a salvo of shells on Israeli soldiers at the Fatima Gate in the village of Kfar Kila (Marjayoun, Al Nabatieh). Hezbollah claimed it achieved direct injuries. Casualties unknown. The attack was claimed in support of Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip, as well as their resistance, and in defense of Lebanon and its people. The Israeli army also fired artillery shells.

assoc_actor_2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
source: Deutsche Welle; L'Orient Le Jour; National News Agency Lebanon
notes: On 10 October 2024, Hezbollah fighters launched guided missiles at an Israeli tank advancing toward Ras al Naqoura (Tyr, South). Hezbollah claimed the vehicle was destroyed and its crew was killed and injured (claimed fatalities coded as 0). Hezbollah continued four times to hit with rockets Israeli soldiers who were attempting to get to the wounded soldiers. 2 Israeli military vehicles caught fire. During these ground operations, Israeli troops opened fire on three positions held by UN peacekeepers at the main UNIFIL base. The soldiers hit the entrance to the bunker where peacekeepers were taking refuge, damaging vehicles and a communications system. Two peacekeepers were wounded when an Israeli army Merkava tank fired at an observation tower. The Israeli army claimed it was an accident and that they will conduct an investigation, though on 13 October 2024, Netanyahu called on UNIFIL to immediately move from their positions and explained that Israel had asked UNIFIL several times to leave but was met with repeated refusals. Israeli soldiers also fired artillery shells in the Hamoul area within the city.

On 6 October 2024, Israeli warplanes carried out an airstrike in Ras al Naqoura (Tyr, South). At least one person was killed. This event is part of the Israeli army's announcement of intensified bombing in Lebanon, including in the north, where it claimed to have pushed back Hezbollah, as part of the 'new phase' of Israel's war on Gaza, in the midst of hostilities against Hezbollah.

source: El Nashra; National News Agency Lebanon
notes: On 6 October 2024, the Israeli army completely destroyed a mosque in Yaroun (Bint Jbeil, Al Nabatieh) presumably via remote explosives. Casualties unknown.
